Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial of Stem Cell Therapy for Myocardial Regeneration

Trial_Design.evidence: A multicenter randomised controlled trial was conducted.

Participants.evidence: Participants with ischemic cardiac injury and NYHA class I-III symptoms were included.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention group received 150 million autologous BM MSCs, 5 million c-kit+ CPCs, or both via transendocardial injection. The control group received PlasmaLyte A.

Objective.evidence: Objective: To evaluate the effect of stem cell therapy on cardiac function.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) over a six-month period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was achieved using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors and patients.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 144 participants were randomised.

Result_Outcome.evidence: LVEF changes were not significantly different between the intervention and control groups. However, the occurrence of major adverse cardiac events was significantly reduced in the CPC group (p = 0.043).

Harms.evidence: No severe adverse events were reported, indicating the safety of the intervention.

Funding.evidence: The trial was funded by the National Institutes of Health.
